thread.title: Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win
thread.title_full: Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win

author: STEPHEN HAWKINS
title: Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win
text:
Rod Aydelotte Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Baylor quarterback Seth Russell, left, is stopped on a running play by Iowa State defensive back Jomal Wiltz (17) in the fourth quarter of an NCAA college football game Saturday Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. According to team officials, Russell, who left the game after the play, suffered a fractured bone in his neck on the play. (Rod Aydelotte /Waco Tribune-Herald via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Baylor wide receiver KD Cannon (9) leaps over Iowa State defensive back De'Monte Ruth (6) gaining extra yardage on a pass play in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Iowa State linebacker Reggan Northrup (9) closes in as Baylor's Shock Linwood (32) looks for running room in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Iowa State defensive back Jomal Wiltz (17) reaches out but is unable to reach a pass intended for Baylor's KD Cannon, rear, in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Baylor running back Shock Linwood (32) attempts to get by Iowa State linebacker Jarnor Jones (12) in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Baylor quarterback Seth Russell (17) scrambles out of the pocket as Iowa State linebacker Jarnor Jones (12) pursues in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Fans protected against a heavy rain watch as Iowa State and Baylor line up against each other in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Baylor wide receiver Chris Platt (14) is unable to escape a tackle by Iowa State's Sam E. Richardson (4) with help from defensive back Qujuan Floyd (7) in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Iowa State quarterback Sam B. Richardson (12) scrambles out of the pocket in the first half of an NCAA college football game against Baylor Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win 
Iowa State running back Mike Warren (2) helps against pressure as quarterback Sam B. Richardson (12) prepares to pass against Baylor in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Waco, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Russell hurt in No. 2 Baylor's 20th straight home win Associated Press | 
WACO, Texas (AP) — Second-ranked Baylor stretched its FBS-best home winning streak to 20 games without being the point-a-minute Bears everyone has been used to seeing. 
Their big concern now is the health of quarterback Seth Russell, who sustained a fracture in one of the bones in his neck late in the Bears' 45-27 victory over Iowa State on Saturday.
